description.narrative: The action will be implemented by an established consortium of 3 INGOs (VSF-Germany, ACTED and ACF) while TI-Kenya(focusing on accountability and transparency) and REACH (ACTED's sister-organization - focusing on development of information tools for humanitarian decision making and planning) will provide technical support in accountability and transparency. The consortium members and their local partners have strong experience in ASALs Resilience programming including Disaster Preparedness and Response. This action builds on 5 previous phases of DG ECHO investment and aims at enhancing DRR and resilience of vulnerable communities in the ASALs. Disaster Risk Management is a shared function between National and County Governments in Kenya. This action will strengthen linkages between community institutions, County and National structures. It focuses on capacity development of and by vulnerable communities and their institutions at community, county and national levels to improve risk informed programming. The action will use CMDRR, conflict and gender-sensitive approaches with a crisis modifier to ensure equitable access to essential services by communities at the earliest opportunity of a crisis through an “emergency envelope.”
